Class RmiClient

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am22new.Network.RMI.Client.RmiClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
VirtualServer, VirtualView, Serializable, Remote
public class RmiClient extends UnicastRemoteObject implements VirtualView, VirtualServer
The RmiClient class serves as a Remote Method Invocation (RMI) client for connecting and interacting with a remote VirtualServer. It provides a variety of methods to manage the client's interaction with the game, including connecting to the server, managing players, and executing game-related actions asynchronously. The class also handles communication between the EnhancedClientView and the server.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • RmiClient

      public RmiClient(EnhancedClientView clientView, ClientModel clientModel) throws RemoteException
      Constructs an RmiClient instance to manage the interaction between the client view and the client model in an RMI-based game application.
      Parameters:
      clientView - the enhanced client view responsible for handling the user interface and displaying updates to the player
      clientModel - the client-side representation of the game model used to store and handle game-related data and logic
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if there is an error during the creation of the remote object

  • Method Details

    • connectToServer

      public void connectToServer(String host, int port) throws RemoteException, NotBoundException
      Establishes a connection to a remote server using Java RMI. This method locates the registry running on the provided host and port, and retrieves a reference to the remote server object.
      Parameters:
      host - the hostname or IP address of the RMI registry
      port - the port number on which the RMI registry is running
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if an error occurs during communication with the registry
      NotBoundException - if the specified name is not bound in the registry

    • connectToServerRMI_GUI

      public static RmiClient connectToServerRMI_GUI(String host, int port, String name, ClientModel clientModel, GalaxyTruckerGUI view) throws InterruptedException
      Establishes a connection to the server using a Graphical User Interface (GUI). This method handles connecting to the RMI server, registering the client, and initiating the heartbeat mechanism.
      Parameters:
      host - the server's hostname or IP address
      port - the port number on which the server is listening
      name - the player's chosen nickname
      clientModel - the client-side representation of the game model
      view - the GUI object used for display and user interaction
      Returns:
      an RmiClient instance that facilitates communication with the server, or null if the connection fails
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting

    • run

      public void run(String playerName, Scanner scanner)
      Executes the main client logic for connecting to the server and initializing the game. This method handles user input for the player's nickname, validates it with the server, and starts the client's command loop upon successful connection.
      Parameters:
      playerName - the initial nickname of the player; can be null or empty to prompt for input
      scanner - a Scanner object used to read input from the console

      public String getPlayerName()
      Retrieves the name of the player associated with this client.
      Returns:
      the name of the player as a String

      public void connectWithNickname(String nickname) throws RemoteException

      Parameters:
      nickname - the player's chosen nickname to be used during the connection
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if an error occurs while communicating with the server

      Establishes a connection between a virtual client view and the server, using the provided nickname.
      Specified by:
      connect in interface VirtualServer

      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs during the connection

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      Disconnects the RMI client from the server and shuts down client-side resources. This operation terminates ongoing tasks, releases resources, and stops the application. It ensures to halt any running executors or schedulers in the client environment.
      Specified by:
      disconnect in interface VirtualServer

    • pickCoveredTile

      public void pickCoveredTile(String nickname)
      Requests the server to allow the player with the specified nickname to pick a covered tile asynchronously. The request is submitted for execution and handled in a separate thread to avoid blocking the caller.
      Specified by:
      pickCoveredTile in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player attempting to pick a covered tile

    • pickUncoveredTile

      public void pickUncoveredTile(String playerName, String pngName) throws IOException
      Submits a task to asynchronously request the server to allow the specified player to pick an uncovered tile identified by its PNG file name. This method ensures that the operation is performed without blocking the main thread.
      Specified by:
      pickUncoveredTile in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      playerName - the nickname of the player making the request to pick an uncovered tile
      pngName - the name of the PNG file representing the uncovered tile to be picked
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the communication with the server

    • weldComponentTile

      public void weldComponentTile(String playerName, int i, int j, int numOfRotation) throws IOException
      Asynchronously welds a component tile for the specified player by invoking the server's weldComponentTile method. This involves placing the component tile on the given coordinates with a specified number of rotations.
      Specified by:
      weldComponentTile in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the player attempting to weld the component tile
      i - the x-coordinate on the grid where the component tile should be placed
      j - the y-coordinate on the grid where the component tile should be placed
      numOfRotation - the number of 90-degree clockwise rotations to apply to the tile
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input or output error occurs during the operation

    • standbyComponentTile

      public void standbyComponentTile(String playerName) throws IOException
      Requests the server to place the currently held component tile into standby mode for the specified player. The operation is executed asynchronously using a separate thread.
      Specified by:
      standbyComponentTile in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the player requesting to place the component tile into standby
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the operation

    • pickStandbyComponentTile

      public void pickStandbyComponentTile(String playerName, int index)
      Sends a request to pick a standby component tile for the specified player at the given index. The operation is executed asynchronously to prevent blocking the main application thread.
      Specified by:
      pickStandbyComponentTile in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      playerName - the nickname of the player making the request
      index - the position of the tile to be picked from the standby tiles

    • discardComponentTile

      public void discardComponentTile(String playerName) throws IOException
      Asynchronously requests the server to discard a component tile associated with the specified player. This method delegates the request to the server in a separate thread to prevent blocking the main execution flow.
      Specified by:
      discardComponentTile in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the player whose component tile is to be discarded
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the communication with the server

    • finishBuilding

      public void finishBuilding(String playerName) throws IOException
      Notifies the server that the specified player has finished building their ship asynchronously. This method submits the task to an executor to avoid blocking the calling thread.
      Specified by:
      finishBuilding in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the player who has finished building
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs when communicating with the server

    • finishBuilding

      public void finishBuilding(String playerName, int index) throws IOException
      Submits a request to finish the building process for a player asynchronously. This method delegates the task to the server to mark a player's building process as completed based on the given player name and index of the building stage.
      Specified by:
      finishBuilding in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the player who is completing the building process
      index - the index indicating the specific building stage to complete
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during communication with the server

    • finishedAllShipboards

      public void finishedAllShipboards()
      Signals the server that all shipboards have been finalized. This method is executed asynchronously using a separate thread in the executor service to avoid blocking the main thread. If an IOException occurs during the communication with the server, an error message is printed to the console. The server's responsibility is to handle the logic associated with the finalization of all shipboards. This action might signify the advancement to the next phase in the game or the conclusion of a specific segment within the game logic. Note: The server-side implementation of this action is defined in the `server.finishedAllShipboards()` method, which is executed in the try block.
      Specified by:
      finishedAllShipboards in interface VirtualServer

    • flipHourglass

      public void flipHourglass() throws IOException
      Initiates an asynchronous operation to flip the hourglass in the game. This method delegates the flipping operation to the server by submitting a task to an executor. If an IOException occurs during the server operation, the error message will be logged to the console.
      Specified by:
      flipHourglass in interface VirtualServer
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the operation initiated by the server's implementation

    • pickCard

      public void pickCard() throws IOException
      Initiates the process of picking a card by delegating the call asynchronously to the server. This method submits a task to an executor service, ensuring that the server's pickCard operation is performed on a separate thread to avoid blocking the main thread. If an IOException occurs during the server's pickCard operation, it is caught and its message is logged to the standard output.
      Specified by:
      pickCard in interface VirtualServer
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the pickCard operation on the server

    • activateCard

      public void activateCard(InputCommand inputCommand) throws IOException
      Activates a card using the provided input command. This method submits the activation task to an executor, which handles it asynchronously. In case of an error during card activation, the exception is logged.
      Specified by:
      activateCard in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      inputCommand - the command containing the details required to activate the card
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the card activation process

    • removePlayer

      playerAbandons in interface VirtualServer

      destroyComponentTile in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:

    • endGame

      public void endGame() throws IOException
      Ends the current game session by asynchronously invoking the server's endGame method. The method submits a task to the internal executor to handle the operation in a separate thread. If an IOException occurs during the operation, the error is caught and logged to the console.
      Specified by:
      endGame in interface VirtualServer
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the game termination process

    • placeBrownAlien

      public void placeBrownAlien(String playerName, int i, int j)
      Asynchronously places a brown alien on the game board for the specified player at the given coordinates. This method uses a separate thread to process the request to avoid blocking the main flow of execution.
      Specified by:
      placeBrownAlien in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the player performing the action
      i - the row index where the brown alien is to be placed
      j - the column index where the brown alien is to be placed

    • placePurpleAlien

      public void placePurpleAlien(String playerName, int i, int j)
      Places a purple alien on the game grid at the specified position for a given player. This method executes the operation asynchronously, delegating the request to the server.
      Specified by:
      placePurpleAlien in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the player requesting to place the purple alien

    • heartbeat

      public void heartbeat(String playerName)
      Sends a heartbeat signal to the server to indicate that the client is still active and connected. This method helps in maintaining the connection and detecting client-side disconnections.
      Specified by:
      heartbeat in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the player sending the heartbeat signal

    • quit

      public void quit(String playerName)
      Terminates the player's session and shuts down the client application. This method invokes the server-side quit operation for the specified player and subsequently shuts down the client resources, including thread pools and heartbeat mechanisms.
      Specified by:
      quit in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the player who is quitting the session

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      Shuts down the client application and its associated resources. This method performs the following operations: 1. Shuts down the heartbeat scheduler if it is not null. 2. Initiates the shutdown of the executor service and attempts to await its termination within a specified time limit. 3. If the executor does not terminate within the time limit, it forcefully shuts it down. 4. Exits the application by terminating the JVM. Note: Invoking this method will terminate the entire application.

    • showLobbyUpdate

      public void showLobbyUpdate(List<String> players, Map<String,Boolean> readyStatus, String gameType)
      Displays an update of the lobby to the client view, including the list of players, their readiness status, and the selected game type. This method is invoked whenever there is a change in the lobby state.
      Specified by:
      showLobbyUpdate in interface VirtualView
      Parameters:
      players - a list of player nicknames currently in the lobby
      readyStatus - a map containing each player's readiness status, where the key is the player's nickname and the value is a boolean indicating whether the player is ready (true) or not (false)
      gameType - a string representing the type of game selected for the session

    • showConnectionResult

      public void showConnectionResult(boolean isHost, boolean success, String message)

      Specified by:
      showConnectionResult in interface VirtualView
      Parameters:
      isHost - true if the client is acting as the host; false otherwise
      success - true if the connection was successful; false if the connection failed
      message - the message providing details about the connection result

    • terminate

      public void terminate() throws RemoteException
      Terminates the current client's session and performs necessary cleanup steps. This method is typically invoked when the host is reconfiguring the game lobby, providing feedback to the user about the current state of the server and allowing reattempts to connect or perform other operations without forcibly ending the application. If the client is using a graphical interface, the view may be switched to the server connection screen, enabling the user to retry.
      Specified by:
      terminate in interface VirtualView
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a communication-related error occurs during the execution of the method

    • showUpdateStopHourglass

      public void showUpdateStopHourglass() throws RemoteException
      Handles the logic to stop the hourglass mechanism for the client. This is invoked to update the client-side model to disable any time-based countdowns or timers that may be associated with the game. This method utilizes the stopHourglass function within the ClientModel to perform the necessary operations for halting the hourglass, including deactivation of the timer and notifying relevant components about this change.
      Specified by:
      showUpdateStopHourglass in interface VirtualView
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a communication-related error occurs during the execution of this remote method

    • showUpdateStartHourglass

      public void showUpdateStartHourglass(int hourglassSpot) throws RemoteException
      Displays the start of an hourglass timing period in the client view. This method delegates the action to the client model to initiate the hourglass timer based on the specified spot.
      Specified by:
      showUpdateStartHourglass in interface VirtualView
      Parameters:
      hourglassSpot - an integer representing the specific position or identifier of the hourglass to start.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a communication-related exception occurs during the remote method call.

    • getVirtualServerType

      public String getVirtualServerType()

      a string representing the type of the virtual server, which is "rmi"
